title: Archie Mountbatten-Windsor has his first playgroup session and 'loved it', Prince Harry and Meghan tell children
text:
Archie Mountbatten-Windsor has attended his first playgroup session at the age of five months, his proud mother has revealed .

Archie has been to a local baby group in Windsor with the Duchess of Sussex, who said he "loved it".

The Duchess happily shared the update about the seventh-in-line to the throne during the annual WellChild awards in London, where she and the Duke met with seriously ill children and their families.

The Duchess told one girl and her mother: “I just took Archie for his first [playgroup] class. It was a lot of fun. He loved it.”

The Duke and Duchess had been in conversation with Milly Sutherland, 11, and her mother Angela, 50, in a reception for winners of the inspiring awards at the Royal Lancaster hotel.

Angela said: “She took him to one of these baby classes today and she said they had loads of fun together. She said it was really good fun.”
description: Archie Mountbatten-Windsor has attended his first playgroup session at the age of five months, his proud mother has revealed .
